intro: Cephaelis ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and Western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cephaelis ituriensis is often found in shaded, humid environments and is adapted to thrive in the understory of dense tropical forests.
